alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Comanche; Kiowa; Tillman (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 10:13PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Comanche, southwestern Caddo, southeastern Kiowa and north central Tillman Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1013 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Cooperton, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lawton, Cache, Elgin, Apache, Snyder, Mountain Park, Medicine Park, Indiahoma, Manitou, Cooperton, Meers, Lake Lawtonka, Boone, Fort Sill, Lake Ellsworth, Tom Steed Reservoir, Wichita Mountains Wildlife Refuge, Mount Scott, Doris Campground and The Visitor Center. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 37 and 55. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
